name: MAGIC ITEM (4): SIAMESE CAT
description:
Inspired artisans of Japan made this porcelain statue of a Siamese Cat in the decade following the end of the second World War.

It was likely used as a piece of decor for middle class American homes in the 1950's at the very time when the 'indoor cat' began to be a beloved pet in the suburban home of the nuclear family, as the beloved family dog had been in the agrarian homes of prior generations.

This statue gives off a warm presence while it's surface is cool to the touch in any weather, it retains it's glossy smooth finish and relaxing calming aura despite the turbulent world events of the atomic era when it was created.

This digital "token" confers upon you
a portion of the aesthetic and para-natural
power of this radiant meta-object.

Think on the maker of this physical item
and send them your gratitude
through the centuries - for the
privilege of holding it's
meta-verse avatar.

I took this photo and was blessed
by this object and the sincere
expression of it's maker.

I truly hope my photo gives a portion
of that warmth and comfort to you.

HPL
